attributes.comment:
Reason tells me that raising the application fees for immigration forms in one shot
will not encourage immigrants to register. Registered immigrants add to the U.S.
economy and society as they pay taxes and fly above the radar. Non-registered or
illegal immigrants do not pay taxes.

Why do the registered ones also then must pay more up front? It certainly does
not make sense to me. $905 is far far too much to file a form, not matter how
complex. Immigrating is not only difficult with the technicalities of the forms and
having enough money in resources to qualify, but adding thousands of dollars in
form fees force decent people to buck the system because they could never save
that much money in their own countries.

The government does not need to take more money from these people trying to
make a better life for their families.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Julia E. Jarrett
